This a such a great game, glad I gave it a chance. At first I thought it was just a classic game Simulator, but as you progress and really mess with the environment and listen carefully you reveal a much darker plot. 
Tons of replayability and mini games are relaly fun to play, also the VHS provide many easter eggs to other games and movies.
Bang for your Buck? Price isnt too bad for the experience and replayability but the game is short if you plan on playing it once. it does allow you to replay with NewGame Plus tho.  
Highly reccomended game if you havent tried it.
i loved the game im so happy i got this 100/100

All the bad reviews are people who didn’t play the whole game through. Plus there’s so many hidden secrets and mini games.
Really good game ive played for about three days and its awesome but my kid wizard book wont work so please fix. and its easy to aim

review_title: This game should be on the Oculus quest

I've wanted to play duck season for the longest time and i pretty much beat it within an hour so don't expect too much of a thrill it has 7 endings so it has replayability! its pretty fun really recommend it!

review_title: Best Horror VR Game Ever Created
one_reviews_text: The game is so nervewracking, I just love it so much.
this game is one of the best out there it feels like your accutaly hunting with the amzing graphics and mechanics
Alot of fun!!! My kid wizard book doesnt work though so I can't get the secret ending :(

This game is a head trip. I love the idea and the story. But I do feel like it drags its feet a bit. The Duck Hunt game is fun for about the first three or four times, after that those segments are just a chore to play through. Still worth the pricetag, and I really look forward to whatever else this company has in store for VR.
I give it 5 stars, but it is too scary for me. I wish it was without the scary part...
This was expected from the same people who made BONEWORKS.Much worth the money and the fact that it's not only just shooting ducks is above creative.A very good game.
its good

I own a Rift S myself and have found no problems with it. I think that this game is perfect for people looking for some nostalgia, the game has got 8-bit games, mini shooting games, a lot of endings, lots of lore, lots of secrets and just about enough horror to make you feel thrilled while playing. Igive this game a 5 star rating because for a price of 15 quid this game is a bargain, it is really worth your time and money. I can't wait for Stress Level Zero to finish off the other two games (Boneworks is another brilliant game that has come out) to complete the lore for this series. Also, I suggest that the comfort level is modified, this game is quite 'comfortable' for the most part but in some scenes it can become 'intense', so I do suggest that the comfort rating is changed to a moderate.

I played this for about an hour, played through I think level 5 of duck hunt and also played some of the other games, beat Triple Tiger.  I guess it was an ok nostalgia trip, but uh...was something else supposed to happen?  If so, it takes waaaay to long to get there.  After an hour I was completely bored, so maybe something exciting happens later.  If so, probably shouldn't make it take so long to get to an interesting part.

It was fun the first time i played, i didn't know what was going to happen. The second time was alright and by the third time there was just no reason to play anymore. Getting all of the ending sounds like a fun quest until you play a few times and realize its the same thing over and over again, with a slight difference at the end. You have to get to level four before anything remotely odd happens, and to level six before the game starts to pick up. and just when that happens, its over. You find out the dog is evil, and then 20 minutes later the game ends. in three hours i got four endings, and have completely lost interest in trying to get the other three. It feels like they just wanted to make it just long enough that you couldn't return it after you were bored, but not too long becuase that would take to much effort.

review_title: Excellent game. Have a few suggestions
one_reviews_text:
.Supports Kazoo
.Supported Player modes: If you're not sitting on the floor for the first part, you're not doing it right. 
.Comfort level: goes from nostalgia rush to DoomSlayer real quick

And now, the suggestions: 

.The physics are a little wonky. For example, grabbing the toy gun will cause other objects to fly about. Please fix that when possible
.Now that I've beaten the Canon storyline, "Come Face Me" should be replayable.  It was probably my favorite level.  
Other than that, it's definitely worth a buy! (As long as you have an Oculus Rift CV1, apparently the Rift S has some tracking issues with this one.) Toodles!
d o n o t l o o k b e h i n d y o u o n l e v e l 8 y o u w i l l r e g r e t i t, well, on stage 4  actually its either level 8 or 9 anyways, amazing game and would reccommedn to other people.
This game was super fun to go through. The twists it throws at you as you dive into the deeper meaning and lore of this game is astonishing. It is worth your money.
Its scary fun and gun
Jittery tracking on the Rift S still not fixed!? I've given up waiting for a fix. Total waste of money for the Rift S.

I have the rift S, this game is amazing and there is so many little things to do besides the main story line. And if you just want to play duck season without the scary, theres ways to do that! Its awesome!
THEY STILL  HAVE NOT PATCHED THE TRACKING PROBLEM ON THE RIFT S AND WILL MOST LIKELY NEVER DO UNTIL THEY FIX THAT THIS IS STAYING 1 STAR

I mean It was so cool because id love the part where you have to shoot the ducks. Other thing the best part of the game for me It was when the dog comes to kill you. That part is very cool because Id love the plasma pistol that game is FANTASTIC AND COOL! but wait thats not all, Id have a little problem that when I get inside the game it crashes sometimes you should fix that problem please.

review_title: Fun little game, but awkward controls
one_reviews_text: I play this game on my Rift with two sensors set up. The game looks great and the horror elements are very interesting. What holds this game back for me though, is the awkward and uncomfortable way you need to position your controller to hold the shotgun. It makes the shooting part of the game even less fun. I also experienced some tracking issues.

I got this game in a pack and just thought it was duck simulator. 
Boy was I wrong, thanks for creeping me out before bed
I however would like to just play the duck part.

I did not experience tracking issues on the Rift S, like other posts said, while running 1.39 and I haven’t put this game down today. The story is great and is unlike any game I have played before, even though it’s based on the classic Duck Hunt. There are eight levels with waves of ducks to shoot, and it’s quite satisfying. The shotgun you use is a pump shotty so you have to pump it after each shot on normal difficulty. If you don’t have your hands on the gun correctly, then you won’t be able to reload it right and I think this is what people are concerned about with “tracking” issues. All in all, great and creepy game check it out!

I really wanted to like this game, but it just isn't fun.... at all. I did one round of duck hunt and thought "ok, that was cool for a starting round", but no that's all it is, vr duck hunt. I guess there's more to it near the end but I couldn't stand playind a dozen rounds of the same thing to maybe see something. All in all a bad game, if you could call it a game.

Game was great love the horrer element to this game. My only problem is I notice the game can fight with you if you have the rift s as tracking is bad for this game. Regular rift owners will have no problem. If you can deal with the ocasional tracking issue then you will have much joy in this game.

I wanted to like this game but the tracking on the Rift S is just bad at a game like this. When you add in the repetitive nature of the game I couldn’t even make it through one play through. Great idea for a game but the rift s kind of ruins it

I always whanted to play this game the grafics are nice the story is nice and I especially like that this game has different endings so you can play hours and hours without getting bored. REALLY NICE GAME

Fun game to play. So many different endings and hidden easter eggs in the game too. Purchased this game when it first came out and never wrote a review until now.  Really didn't expect horror in the game since they didn't have screenshots or mentions of it, or any reviews up on it, since I purchased it when it first got released. It was a nice surprise to me.

I don't like how the all the levels are all the same, same background, same gun, same ducks, etc. The only things that were different were the endings and in between level scenes/interactions.

Overall I liked it . Definitely took me back to my old days of when I was a kid playing Nintendo in the late 80's and early 90's.
Great game. Played for hours. Please bring it to the Quest with cross buy. Or at least a cross discount?
This game is so creative I can't even begin to express it. I have been following the guys from SL0 for a long time and love this game so much. I am so excited to see what the future holds

Great environment, graphics, and story despite only a few hours of gamplay (where half of it is shooting ducks). The frightning parts definitely make me not want to play anymore. Downside is there's practically no movement around so it's a living room simulator. However, the game provides an awesome experience with a small but fair amount of stuff to do and explore, with some replay value.
Nes duck hunt in vr but this time the dog is the hunter i think...!!? ;)

review_title: A game for those who grew up in the 80s
one_reviews_text: I am 46 and grew up in the 80s with blockbuster video and sega genesis etc. The house that has been created in this game takes me back to my childhood with the VHS tapes you can play and the cheesy games.  My favorite is "Kazoo Kid" hillarous! The duck hunting game gets old though but must be played to advance the game. Each time you play the duck cartridge and and finish a round it gets later and things get weird. Another reivew mentioned stranger things and this game had the same vibe as it progresses.  Spoiler alert!*** that F*ing dog kiled my mom and attacked me towards the end!! LOL

I bought this game during the Flash Sale for $10. Just the amount of detail and clever design this game offers is worth experieincing the gameplay is alright I may have to readjust my sensors for better tracking. I am a veteran VR player and this game is making it onto my must play lists
Horror= 10/10 fun and scary

At first I thought it was an ok game - the gun play and realistic 80's living room are certainly memorable.  Then I got good at duck hunting.  Buy this game.  Seriuosly.  Stop reading and buy this game.  This is the first time (in nearly 20 games) that I stopped to write a review.

review_title: No one told me this was HORROR!
one_reviews_text:
What starts out as a standard wave shooter soon morphs into a brilliant horror story!

1st Impressions Video with Commentary:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pUyQcgZTpvw

(Please note: Links might not work from Oculus so please search YouTube for 'Paradise Decay VR Duck Hunt')
this game is very fun and scary i like it its fun to mess around
awsome

I had far more gameplay than the one hour other reviewers mention. It's cool to look around, watch all the VHS videos, play all the games and take a look at all the magazines (getting a hint or two on how to solve the puzzles). Were the 80s really that crappy? I fear yes, hehe ;) Then you end the game and find out at some point you failed or missed something... then you try to find out where and how to make it better. Can everybody survive?

You only end up with one hour, when you play only the Duck Season cartridge, one level after the other, not looking around. If this is how you want to play the game, well then yes maybe you will be disappointed.

If you let the game immerse and amaze you, you will get much more out of it.

i really enjoyed this game after the day goes pasing things move around and it get`s spooky and the day turns night but the duck hunt game get`s repetitive realy fast and the tapes and mini-games i think it is so cool i aldready got 4 diferent endings!!!

This is not a horror game, this is not really even shooter, it's a mystery/hidden object puzzle game that forces you to play 8 rounds of a clunky mediocre shooting gallery on top. Not worth the price at all
this game is super gode test it your self i got 3/7

I don't have problems running any other game in my oculus library, but soon as I leave the title screen and enter the game I'm getting 10fps or lower, rendering the game near unplayable. While I'm sure the game is fun, I can't play it for whatever reason. Is there no graphics option?

This game is great and is the reason I bought a Oculus Rift,  It's so fun and spoopy but it's too short.  Each ending takes about an hour or less, And the models are way too different,  The dog is realistic and the child and his mom are cartoony.  It just makes no sense.  But it's a fun game and is good if you want a few screams.
This was one of the greatest VR experiences I have had. Such a creative idea! Mind Blown!

review_title: Short and creepy with some replay value
one_reviews_text: Starts out as a weird VR version of Duck Hunt for NES, but ramps up the creepiness quickly towards the end. Appears to have different endings to unlock, which makes me want to play more now.
I never got to the end. The game is well done and is what it is, but just too boring for me.

Seems the version on the Oculus store has taken a backseat, hasn't been getting the updates rolled out that the Steam version has :/  Devs are apparently aware, but 'no promises' they will find the time to patch it.
It was absolutely horrifying, I couldn't even beat it because at the end I felt like I was about to get a heart attack. GG!

I was told about this game by a friend. I bought VR just so that I could play this. I was not dissapointed. The sudden Horror twist was genius, jumpscares are non existant in this game, I never got bored, It was a blast, alright, it threw me off guard, took things expressed throughout the game as "normal", and then proceeded to flip those things on their head. The cat clock is a strong example, at the beginning of the game, it's ticking. Last few minutes of the game, it's ticking loudly and echoing it's painfully loud meows. Not to mention, next thing you know I'm fighting for my life. I have never been so scared by a VR game, never. The realism shows, the effort shows, and I was shook the whole way. Keep doing what you're doing! The only thing I found dissapointing was that the dog's character i feel wasn't expanded upon enough, but nonetheless, this is the best VR game I've ever played!

I bought this game over half a year ago.  This game is like no other.  It's very funny but also has a dark theme running throughout.  It's exciting, and the way that the game progression depends on the actions of the user (without making that clear to the user), is great.  After my first play-through, I wasn't sure I'd get many hours out of this, BUT I keep coming back to uncover the different endings.  They are strangely rewarding and despite completing the game 5 times, each ending has been different (I think they've done this intentionally).  My only negative is that the duck-shooting gets a little boring, but I'd recommend spending some time between each round and discover the various secrets and stuff in the house.  Some of the video tapes are very funny.  You can play 80s style video games and interact with most objects.  I won't say anything else because the discovery throughout the game is the best part.  I can't compare this to any other game that I've played.  It feels unique.
Great game, the pacing is a tad slow, if they changed that, it would be better, but overall great experience.

Super creepy, love the multiple endings, good value for the price! The only issue I have with it is the controlls can be a bit finicky -- sometimes the gun doesn't pump quite right which can be critical when there are a lot of ducks.
But after some practice, you get used to it.

review_title: Not a bad grab, especially on sale
one_reviews_text:
20 bucks isnt a bad price but if it's on sale its an even better grab. Played through once so far and it's a game I'll definitely come back to. Don't spoil the extra endings for yourself by looking them up online, you'll have more fun replaying and discovering them for yourself.

As others have said, mechanics can be a little shaky when reloading the gun, but once you get the hang of it things run pretty smoothly.

most fun, exciting, thought up vr game i have so far played. being a 30 year old man, this brings back hella memories from my early days. the game setting alone is aweing. im only one level in but i know this game is worth every penny!
and the get your shoulder workout here lol!

review_title: highly recommend but id wait for sale
one_reviews_text:
it was a good game, very immersive took about an hour to complete
it is really just a modernised version of duck hunt that runs a horror story between levels.
multiple endings and interacting with the enviroment give it a bit longer life.

Once  the spook starts to kick in a tad you find yourself waiting for it, almost wanting it. An impatience grips you. I did my first play through on hard and wasnt dissapointed. Plenty of fun can be had to slow down the gameplay and change it up or you can power through in a half hour and get to the juicy bits. 5 starts for good horror that isnt plain jump scares. 4 1/2 stars for controls, yes it could be slightly better but Im not going to gripe a game on lack of perfection when there really isnt perfection out there yet. 5 stars for replay value. With multiple endings and plenty to occupy in game time, youll certainly revisist this game more than once and enjoy the nuanced hat tips to games of ole. 5 stars for a game worth the cash, this isnt another point and shoot or a vr expeirience, it blends both well enough to be an example of solid vr gaming.

While the core gameplay was simple, the world was very well put together and creative. It's becoming obvious to me that worlds that feel 'lived in' is the key to a truly immersive memorable experience. You almost feel like you were just plopped in a 80's living room, (alternate universe 80s that is). Could I tell you anything about that sci fi game I played last week with the crazy environments and monsters? No. But ask me a week from now about what I remember about this game. I would remember quite a bit because it almost felt like I was there. If you watched the trailer to this game and it looks like your type of thing, I recommend to go ahead and buy it on a sale (it's often on sale). Or full price, whatever. What is the price difference? A Big Mac? Sorry, I think of everything in fast food terms.

Biggest gripe:   The gun cocking absolutely sucks.  If they could patch it so your hand snaps to or holds onto the gun better I'd have so much respect for this company.  As it is now, the only time I miss is because my hand is shooting all over the place on a glitchy gun.

A friend recommended this game I'd never heard of.  It looked unique.  So far it's one of the best trying-to-look-like-real-life native vr games I have seen yet.  And creepily it gets even more real, within real.  

I would say it's short... But that does it disservice because it's not a race or a marathon.  It's like a scenario, and the playthrough is actually a little long for one sitting.  It's just the right length, Because of it's art style and how well executed it is, I think I'll get alot of replay out of it and my friends will get a kick out of it.

I found the price a bit high, but I'm glad I got it... I think the developers are really onto something with their whole vision of a game that weirds you out.

If you are thinking about getting it, get it, and don't spoil the endings or gameplay for yourself at all.
I flew through it the first time, only on subsequent playthrought i really appreciated how much effort went in here.  Best VR experience so far.

This game is great and part of what makes it seem so scary is down to Earth horror and some parts seem very real like this isnt you in some lab or some abandoned house with a satanic ritual this is your living room and your tv also this game has somne really funny easter eggs but when the game wants you to take things seriously boy does it want you to do that
wow! the duck hunting part does get repetitive. but as an experiance, this was amazing! I was really disapointed the dog didnt do that laugh, that was dreaded as a child.
The core gameplay of shooting the ducks is repetitive, not challenging and not fun. Everything around the core gameplay is nice however. The atmosphere and the house is fun to explore.
Very good horror game :3

review_title: A strange mix of terror and nostalgia
one_reviews_text:
While it could be said that this leans more towards the side of "experience" rather than Pure Video Game, it manages to create a very personal narrative that will immediately draw you in via this weird, subdued way.

The story unfurls via this slow burn where you just feel some horror bubbling beneath the surface, the nagging suspicion that something is terribly wrong increasing as the game goes by.

To say anything more would be spoiling some of it, but just know that if your childhood memories resemble the scenery, you will definitely get roped in, only to be scared in this primal way only VR games can provide.

Highly recommended.

review_title: it was really well made and really good
one_reviews_text: the game was sad alittle but it was not bad

the heartbeat sound and measurer. when i see the dead mom, the heartbeat sound is there, i noticed that when i calmed down the beating slowed down with it but then it went back up and it came with it because i was FREAKED OUT now let me tell you this, i have a phobia of the sound of a heart beat and what makes my fear even worse is the mesuring of my heart rate. plz remove the heart rate sound and mesurer. after the expirience of the heartbeat sound and mesurer, made me delete this game for MONTHS. please remove the heart rate measurer and heartbeat sound. becauseofmy phobia of heartbeat sound, and what makes my phobia worse that i can never overcome for the rest of my life, is the heart rate measurer

The actual duck hunting is very repetitive and gets boring really fast.  You are forced to play it quite a bit to see the story unfold.  It's well made, but I think the duck hunting part could have been made way shorter or at least more challenging and varied since every level is pretty much identical.
This is the scariest game I have ever played in months!  This is clearly my favorite game!
I quite enjoyed it. About an hour play time, but the story line is quite interesting and there are lots of fun trivia if you look everywhere.
This game exceeded my expectations with it's quirky and explorative interludes, and then the duck hunting game play is excellent fun as well.  Reload often!  A must-have in your VR library.

This is one of the most interesting games I have played. 

Duck Season plays extremely well to the strengths of VR. It offers a profound sense of immersion reinforced by beautiful textures and animations, humor, and secrets galore. You feel nostalgic inside a dense world begging to be explored. The level of detail in this game is impressive. For example, each object has an unique sound effect when dropped. Text on magazines and books is unique (and usually funny). Objects that appear ordinary usually have more in-game significance than first meets the eye. 

Duck Season avoids awkward locomotion with room-based environments. The touch controllers are integrated well into the game, but the hand avatars and touch gestures are not quite as smooth as "First Contact". This is partially due to the 2-handed gun mechanic, where neither touch controller is actually connected to one another. Nevertheless, the developers have created controls that feel natural after a few minutes of practice.

Total playtime is ~2 hours for your first ending. The decision-based endings and myriad easter eggs offer more replay value. I usually hesitate to spend even $20 on a new game, but Duck Season has felt worth it.

I look forward to more titles from Stress Level Zero. I also look forward to other developers learning from Duck Season's strengths for what works in VR: High fidelity objects/environments, mixing humor with narative development, & gameplay that is well-suited for short bursts. For horror-specific games, Duck Season builds a steady sense of dread, without relying on jumpscares or outright gore.

About an hour in and so far what a great game - well produced, tons of extras if you look around, love the TV video segments - everything about this game is great. At $12 right now on sale it's a must own. Also no motion sickness at all - for me, that's a big deal since just about everything makes me motion sick.

The only downside I'd say is that reloading of the pump rifle is hit or miss - it's not broken by any means but sometimes I swear I reloaded the dumb thing and then pull the trigger and nothing. 

Anywho I'm very glad I picked it up.

review_title: This is not Duck Hunt I was expecting.
one_reviews_text:
I've played for the first hour and word of warning don't shot the dog. This game spoke me a bit. But my scary factor tells me it a 3 out of 10 on how scared i was.

As in 10 as the highest scare factor.  I really wasn't that scared at all for most parts. But it really a weird twisted game.
This is a well tought out, and exelently executed game. If you're a late 80/early 90's kid, this is for you.

I’ve played through just about every bit of content available in this game, and I think once I collect the last achievement, I will not have a reason to play again.


Pros:


1) The world is nicely detailed; every item seems to have a bit of text and it makes sense.

2) Easy to get most achievements, if you spread out gameplay, you could get one story evert daily and clean up afterwards.  So about one-week worth of gameplay.

3) Feels like the old duck hunt at heart.

4) Humor is at my level.


Cons:
1) Very short, able to complete one ending in just one sitting.
2) No replay ability after you’ve done everything once.
3) Limited gameplay mechanics: Point, Shoot, Reload, Repeat.
4) Don’t like the shooting mechanic.  Wish there were more weapons or options.


Tips:
1) Play on easy, harder difficulties are for later after you complete all the achievements.
2) Watch out for the glowing shell, you don’t want the nuke ending when going for other endings.
3) Some special features will not work until you clear all endings.


Final thoughts:
Generally, I like it as a time waster.  The setting is pretty nice and the slight horror elements are a bit disturbing for about a second, but you have to try to fail!  Maybe on sale it would be great to pick up for a bit of fun, but it’s not like other titles that I would return to everyday.

review_title: Polished game, glad I only spent $13
one_reviews_text: So this game usually sells for $20 and you will beat this game in about an hour.  I think that's just too little content for the price, even if it is high quality.  I think the sale price of $13 is just right for the amount of content there is.  I give it 4 stars because of the high production values.  What this game gets right is the immersion factor in this 80s retro world with all the little details, which unfortunatley, I am old enough to remember.  I actually played the original Duck Hunt and never imagined there would be something like this that would make that seem archaic (I thought I was playing the future then).  I actually enjoyed the shooting part of this game more than the other parts (creepy story).  There are supposedly 7 endings, but I'm not sure I'd want to play this game 7 times to try to experience those different endings.  Still, I had fun and I'm sure I'll be sharing this experience with friends and family.  I do recommend you get this on sale if you can, if not it's still quality content for $20.

At the time of this review I have only completed one of the supposed 8 endings that are available, that being said, I LOVE THIS GAME. 

The basics:
    (Potential Spoilers Ahead!!) So, before you buy this game, note that it is a HORROR game. My son had watched some youtube videos about this game and told me I should install it, I saw that you could shoot that stupid dog from Nintendo's Duck Hunt, and it was immediately worth the money for me. What my devious 9 year old failed to mention was the fact that this was a HORROR game. Now I am not opposed to horror games, but I usually know that it is a horror game going into it. This was not the case. It should also be noted that this is the first horror game that I have played in VR so I was doubly not ready for the twist at the end. Seriously guys, after level 5 I started getting the creeps, after level 7 or 8 my knees started shaking. After level 9 I had to take a smoke break and rethink my entire life until this point, and after the ending, I changed my underwear and wept into my pillow triumphantly. 

Pros:
-shooting the a-hole dog, repeatedly, like its the point of the game.
-soiling your pants because your 9 year old son is a turd and thinks its funny
-replayability, although this game will admittedly get repetitious trying to find the different endings, its all about that end game baby.
-YOU'RE PLAYING A NINTENDO (not a nintendo due to copyrights or whatever) and you can actually blow into the cartridge, just like old times!!

Cons:
-Sh****ng your pants!
-Repetitiveness
-Dying in the game (and a little inside)

In all, if you were ever a fan of the old Duck Hunt game and want a new, horrifying take on the classic, this game is worth the coin, just make sure you have a change of underwear and some baby wipes at the ready. Consider yourself warned.

review_title: Polished but the game is to short
one_reviews_text: I played through the game in less then a hour. The story is very well done, but their is to little gameplay. Gameplay consist mostly from shooting ducks, but that is so easy and boring. I expected more, much more for this money. I would pay no more then 4€ for it.

I have my oculus for few months and this game made me  to quickly take it down from my head for first time. 
Also it`s really good retro session. 
Oculus must have for people who played video games in nineties.

review_title: Good VR exp, but mediocre game
one_reviews_text: You need to understand that the actual GAME part of this game is just the shooting at ducks part. And there are better VR games where you can achieve the same thing with more features. The real selling point of this game is ofcourse the creepy story around it.

Basically if Duck Hunt had the powers of the videotape from The Ring.  Well designed, smooth experience.  The living room interaction is so well designed, I loved moving stuff around on the floor with the cord from the gun.  The buildup of the story in the last few rounds were very cool.

The game within the game is, as everyone agrees, annoyingly repetitive, especially for a game with multiple endings.  

The endings are amazing though, it's like you're the target of a serial killer.  The 8 levels were worth it for the first two playthroughs...I think it'll be less and less satisying with each subsequent one.

The game takes you back to the good old days, before we've had advanced consoles such as PlayStation and Xbox, to the nintendo vibes and cartridges. 

The game has a lot to explore. A story with 7 endings to discover, and many side objectives, easter eggs, and mini games. 

The game itself is very entertaining, as it keeps you interacting with the world. It has several comedic aspects, as well as terrifying ones. That's right, this game ain't for kids... but it is quite good.

Overall not worth the money. I very much wished they had focused more on expanding the gameplay and fine tuning the shooting mechanics. This only took me 1.5 hours to complete on the hardest difficulty

Baffled as to how anyone really enjoyed this.  Its a very boring shooting game that you have to repeatedly play, to advance the story.  The room is initially nice and quirky, but come on, the novelty lasts for about 10 minutes.  Waste of money, not worth €20 I paid, should be free or 5 bucks.  Avoid.

WOW...if you at all enjoyed Nintendo, then this game will bring you back to that time but with a super (twisted!) twist on it! Multiple endings, SUPER detailed enviroments (I spent at least 30mins just watching the VHS tapes and reading the magazines!) and a enjoyable story makes this one a must buy!

review_title: One of the most interesting games
one_reviews_text: I use the word interesting on purpose. It's pretty fun but nothing special. Controls are decent enough. But the premise is chilling. You kinda get the hint pretty early on, but as the story unfolds it becomes more apparent and more "real?" Would've rather paid $10 or maybe $15 though. $20 seems a bit much.
i got all endings so i beat it but i heard wizerd book got all of those and board of vodo and i heard about the pumkin so i beat that so i hope you put more like that for all seasens[ duck seasen]

Duck Hunter will be most familiar for those who grew up in the 80s/90s playing the NES, reading Nintendo Power and living in suburban North America. I was flooded with nostalgia and really got the sense that I was 12 again, with zero responsibility, spending an entire Saturday parked in front of the TV. The story element of the game is well done, lulling you into a false sense of security, then dropping increasingly overt hints as to the twisted turns ahead. When it gets really f-ed up, I'm reminded of Max Payne or Far Cry games where you're drugged up and running through a bizarro version of the world. Beyond the nostalgia and story, the actual duck hunting is surprisingly fun! However, the shooting/reloading mechanics are a little awkward and don’t live up to the gunplay in games like Robo Recall. Despite its minor flaws, Duck Hunter is one of the most unique games I’ve ever played (visually, emotionally, psychologically, etc.) and really uses VR to its fullest. Totally worth the $20 in my opinion.

review_title: Nice, but not quite worth the money
one_reviews_text: I really enjoyed playing the game, but after approxemately 2 hours the game was over. Because of this I think 20 euros is too much. Sadly this seams to be normal for the most VR games...

review_title: Made with love but very simple game
one_reviews_text: A lot of care and attention has obviously been put into this, from the 8 bit mini-games to the various videos you can play. There are a couple of genuine scares, but the problem is that the duck hunt game itself is quite boring: One gun, shoot ducks. I also often struggled to keep my left hand on the shotgun. Often it would jump off while I was trying to reload. That was more challenging than shooting the ducks. Ultimately the duck shooting just became a way of delaying you getting through the various 'episodes'.

Initially, I expected the game to consist mostly of hunting with little story.  I was wrong because everything is very immersive and well thought-out.  I believed movement mechanics were limited at first with my small play space and the lack of in-game teleportation.  This turned out to not be a flaw and I felt it was well exploited, for lack of better terms, to encourage further exploration.

Pros: It’s playable from sitting, standing or room-scale.  I keep picking it back up and playing for longer than expected.  The graphics and gun/grab physics are clean and very precise.  I can go from shooter mode to explorer mode at will.  I always find new, fascinating things each play.

Cons:  I felt like flaws I’ve seen in other VR games may have existed in this game initially due to a lack of teleportation, though this wasn’t really a concern after I spent more time exploring.

***Slow Clap*** Not only are there cameos from Corridoor Digital, and FreddieW which were my favorite youtube channels. There are tons of uniqe old school games the magazines, and all the extra stuff laying around is worth checking out up close. This game isnt about rushing through it. It has a slow build up, but the tension is worth it. Don't feel bad about shooting the dog every time you get a chance. He deserves it.

Side note.. Still waiting for the other tutorials from your christmas special, and 3DS Max... Just saying.

review_title: Not what I thought it was
one_reviews_text: I don´t know the original game and it feels like 20,00€ wasted. I love the 80- ish American home around me (even if I am not from the US), even if child & mother are kind of badly done (especially the hands; if you move the controllers to certain spots it looks as if the kid is badly disabled). Also the story idea is kind of cool, although not super- innovative. But the rest... you shoot ducks most of the time and that´s it. Re- loading the gun is clumsy and doesn´t work well. And to experience the different endings you have to play the whole boring thing again.

review_title: Good game, Good price, No Content
one_reviews_text: Fun game, but very repetitive. I thought there would be more horror gameplay but there was about 2 minutes of it... Don't buy if you want a horror game. It is a very polished though, just lacking.

Very boring gameplay that revolves around you sitting in a single room and playing a game of Duck Hunt in VR with a shotgun that's cumbersome to use. You play a few rounds of Duck Hunt before the game comes to an end.

There's multiple endings based on what you do but what you're looking at is about an hour or two of gameplay to beat it and to be expected to play it six more times to get the other endings. Sorry but at it's core it's a very simple wave based shooter(Where you'll at max see four birds on screen at a time). The horror aspects in the game aren't remotely scary(Even if you're easily prone to these things) and it takes right up until the end of the playthrough to deliver.

Can't recommend for the asking price, way too expensive and more like a demo you'd play for free to try get people into VR.

review_title: Touch has proper grab buttons, use them.
one_reviews_text: I love the concept, the production values and the insane video tapes you unlock, but for a game about shooting a shotgun, the mechanics feel downright broken. Probably because of the dodgy auto-grip feature, pumping the shotgun fails randomly and it generally feels like the gun has a mind of its own. your pumping hand keeps detaching and the shoulder mechanic just doesn't work imo. Hopefully they can improve on it because the game has a lot of potential!

This game is amazing! When I first played, it entertained me for about 30 minutes, then I thought I would be done with it, because the gameplay gets quite stale. About a week later I came back, and saw all the trippy/ scary story elements, and since then have played through the game at least 4 times. Despite having limited gameplay, the story and different endings will have you coming back over an over. I love it! The only reason I can't justify giving this 5 stars is because of the repetitive gameplay, but seriously dont let that stop you!

review_title: Good game for the asking price.
one_reviews_text:
i saw a few reviews of people saying it was too short for the asking price. but when i tried it myself, i found that the game had supriceingly much content considering that duck season is just about shooting ducks. and you have 3 different difficulty levels and its a game with alot of replayability value. so 20$ is not a high asking price for a polished content rich minigame like this.

i think this game could be a great game to play rounds with friends, and don`t tell them about the plot twist :D
This has to be the most boring vr game i've played in a long time. No content really. Somewhat bad mechanics. Waste of money.

I wonder how many kids have been traumatised because parents thought "hey there is a game for kids with a great rating. Dark twist? I guess they shot bats instead of ducks in the end." 
I love the 80s living room and the attention to detail. Would love to watch an entire episode of A-Team on that TV.

So, what I expected and what I got with this game were very different, but that's a good thing! We all remember duck hunt and the nostalgia it conjures. This is not your father's duck hunt. It's like 3d VR duck hunt with a story and some humor! I really appreciated the humor the developer added to the game. Without it the game would be relatively bland as the actual duck hunting won't keep you enthralled for very long the humor and story keep you hooked between levels. Sadly though, I have to question the replayability and I can't see myself playing it more than maybe 2 or 3 run throughs to see the alternate endings. I was able to beat the game in an hour or two and really enjoyed the game so don't get me wrong I did very much enjoy my experience. I think it's worth 19.99 to 29.99 but don't expect a game that you'll play a thousand times. Enjoy it for what it is and whatever you do, don't piss off the dog!

Super game.  most effective for anyone arround who played games and watched vhs is the 80s.
But don't be fooled this is NOT for kids!!!

Slow build up but pay attention to detail so you can really appreciate the climax - my first playthrough I got the canon ending, on accident of course, and just made the entire experience so worthwhile. I feel like the player should automatically get the canon end first, and then be open to the other ones  (besides the death ones.) Regardless, definitely my VR game of the year.

Great adaptation of the Duck Hunt franchise in VR, but with quite a twist! The experience is very polished and the controls are intuitive. The only negative I have is that the story line feels a bit rushed and underdeveloped close to the end. If it was a bit longer with better  character and story development, I'd give it 5 stars.

Some reviews and screenshots seem to point to a horror type of story and that's what I was expecting. Well I'm like 2 hours in and all I've witnessed is a glorified duck shoot. Am I doing something wrong?
Wish it had an option to use better graphics. Game is pretty good, if not tiring for arms...

Lots of little details in this game like extra carts to play in the faux-NES and video tapes.  Its a rather basic play-thru and will take 60-90 minutes you first time depending how much messing around you do and you'll get to an ending.  

The game has 7 different endings and different achievements.  The endings will require you to spend time messing around in the house to find triggers for the other endings for the most part.

Cool game, fun weekender to play around with.
Everything about this game feels very crafted and well put together, there's so much to explore. It has almost a FNAF sort of horror but it goes much deeper and darker than you'd think.

The games 3 rounds till level 5, then it gets interesting changing the story based on the objects you interact with before going to the next level. double kills and one handed kills are hard to do. STRONGLY not suggested for kids, but amazing for everyone else, even has freemode.

Gets repetitive, no real competition mode here even on the hardest settings.
Lacks randomnessssssss... worth the buy if you got cash to blow

Wish there was more horror and less shooting. After all, it gets tiresome shooting the ducks for 8 levels. Even with changing storylines, I won't want to play it again. However, the living room feeling has great potential, you should make a spinoff VR video player from that! I wish I could walk around more in the house as it could be a whole world of mini games!

review_title: Very retro shooter, but with few issues.
one_reviews_text:
Yes this is a pretty much short game. but its more or less like The Stanley Parable. There is a lots of stuff in the living room and secrets room as well. They are fun to discover as well. Stuff that is nothing with ducks at all (mini games etc). Its also a experince too.

One issue throught. The ducks should fly faster after you completed about 3 endings and more easy to fly away. There was no advance here, and that can been quite boing in the last.

But.... get it.... its fun dispite that.

review_title: Just as it gets interesting, it ends
one_reviews_text: It's a very detailed game, and I've gotten 3/7 endings so far. Fun, at times funny, at times spooky. However, it's crippled by constant repitition and an underlying concept that, while intriguing, just isn't executed very well.

OK first off this game was great, the graphics, the game play, the extras, just everything was great. If you have a spare 20$ and looking for something fun i would suggest getting this.  

My only complaint is it was a bit short for the money.  at 10 or 15 $ i would have no complaints and gave 5 stars.
have you ever asked yourself,"what if stephen king made duck hunt?" no? me neither, but now i know what if he did..........and i kinda like it
Nice Game but realy quick story and for that 20 $? hmmm don't know maybe you do some updates? idk the game is new so.....

wow! Duck Season, thats great i understand the whole thing about revisiting the childhood, lets cut to the chase, game is not worth the cost, to much of the same, shootgun is so long it doesn feel right, tracking is horrible , reloading the shell is bad, makes my arms tired, wish i can get a refund, dont waste your time buying this game...developers shoud copy from other titles and start making some real vr games

The game itself is ok. The added mystery was good and the fact that there are many endings give it some re-playability. But I think there should have been more levels. Overall I think this is really kewl but I would definitely would wait for a sale on this one.

This is a great flashback for me. The attention to detail was really good. You can even blow into the nintendo cartridges like you used to have to! lol. This could be considered another kind of flashback as well because it's pretty trippy. The VHS tapes and stuff are pretty far out there. Just a great bit of fun and well put together.

Having grown up with the Regular Nintendo I can truly appreciate what they have made here. The living room inbetween levels is my favorite. The gun is amazing! Shooting ducks has never been so fun. Hard to put down!

All is not what it seems.....

The nostalgia is strong with this game, especailly if you were a child of the 80's.  MUST BUY.

Game is technically very short but there is lots to do in the living room including playing a bunch of "crappy" old NES style games.

Quite possibly the best VR experience I've had to date. The gun play is absolutely amazing. The attention to detail in every aspect of the environment is sublime. Sam is wonderful giving the tutorial. All the vhs tapes that you can play are hilarious. Having the tv so low to the ground makes me naturally want to sit and play the console games from the floor.

This gives me hope for the future of VR. Its so nice to know that my generation that grew up playing games, are taking nostalgia to the next level. I had so much fun playing this and really hope there are more games like this in the future! I love not only the shooting part but all the other fun things of being in his house, with the newscasts, etc. just made it an A+ experience.
fun game
It's a little repetitive and short, but still fun and interesting nonetheless. It has a great atmosphere, really liked it.
Very interactive and funny. This is what VR games should be. Highly recommended.
A mosquito was so real I tried to swat it.  The underwater scene is VR at its best.  Really like the nostalgia of the OG Duck Hunt days and the general twistedness of the game is next level.
this game is just amazing.
awesome and there are 7 endings just get it

Amusing story in between levels breaks up the monotony and gives your arms a break.

Would be nice if the short shucking the shotgun wasn't such an issue. Still haven't played a game that gets this right.
I liked the 80's games and duck hunt so i enjoy the game. If you were born in the 80's or took part in the 80's games you should enjoy this. Brings back some old memorys :D

review_title: Pretty fun, but one thing bothered me
one_reviews_text: I couldn't play Final Fiesta II.....
you. shoot. ducks.  ._.
Very short
The game is very fun and scary at times but can get repetitive.
Very well made, great atmosphere, fun to play, surprisingly dark.  Nice one.
This is really cool if you were a kid in the 80's.

review_title: love the guys at Stress Level Zero
one_reviews_text: awsome pice of work I can tell a lot of work went in to the detail of this game. awsome game!!!!

review_title: Brandon and your team you my boyz
one_reviews_text: Actually love the game 20/10
One of the best games for VR!
